main event: An unidentified flying object, described as a white sphere blending into reddish tones, was observed for approximately 2-3 seconds moving horizontally from right to left before suddenly disappearing in Great Kills, New York on June 14, 1954 at 0130 hours.
interesting points: The object was described as a white sphere blending into reddish tones at the circumference.
No magnifiable features or details, tail, trail, or exhaust were observed, and no sound was heard from the object.
Immediately after the object vanished, the western sky lit up as if by 'heat lightning', but no sound of lightning was heard.
The object's vertical movement was approximately the same in length as its horizontal movement.
The observer claimed to have 20/20 vision and had not been drinking at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: unidentified flying object described as a white sphere blending into reddish tones
